stories.title: Show HN: Build internal tools in Google Sheets

stories.text:
I'm really on the fence on this. Here is my short-list of Pro/Cons:

>> LAPTOP PRO

— fluid ergonomics — These days our son uses our laptop usually on the couch, laying down. This is way more comfortable than sitting down. — mobility — Has the ability to take the laptop on a trip/plane

>> LAPTOP CON

— high risk for damage / delicate / low longevity — Because it is mobile it can risk damage during travel or just carrying it around.

— 2x LESS bang for the $ — He is a gamer and it would cost 2x more to get the same performance as the desktop

>> DESKTOP PRO

— 2x MORE Bang for the $ — — 2x larger Screen — Less Delicate

— More Parental Control — if I set it up in our living room, we can get a better sense of what he is doing.

>> DESKTOP CON

— rigid ergonomics —

He will be forced to sit still for 2-3hrs. ( im debating if this is a negative thing! ) but it will basically start him on a sitting habit very early in his development life. *Now, im thinking I can just setup a standing desk for him instead..which would tire him out quicker and reduce his usage. hmm
stories.title: Ask HN: Would you get a laptop or desktop for a 9yr old?
Bosch gives go-ahead for volume production of silicon carbide chips
